clean_text: The type of transport, as well as the volume and movement of vehicles, can affect biodiversity. Different modes of transport have different implications in terms of ecosystem damage, fuel and energy use, emissions, pollution and noise. The effects of vehicular traffic can include direct impacts, localised indirect impacts and wider indirect impacts such as air pollution and contributions to climate change, both of which have major implications for biodiversity.
raw_text: The type of transport, as well as the volume and movement of vehicles, can affect biodiversity. Different modes of transport have different implications in terms of ecosystem damage, fuel and energy use, emissions, pollution and noise. The effects of vehicular traffic can include direct impacts (e.g. animal strikes leading to injury or death), localised indirect impacts (e.g. noise disturbance) and wider indirect impacts such as air pollution and contributions to climate change, both of which have major implications for biodiversity.

sentences.text: The type of transport, as well as the volume and movement of vehicles, can affect biodiversity.
Different modes of transport have different implications in terms of ecosystem damage, fuel and energy use, emissions, pollution and noise.

The effects of vehicular traffic can include direct impacts, localised indirect impacts and wider indirect impacts such as air pollution and contributions to climate change, both of which have major implications for biodiversity.

clean_text: Providing parking areas at the venue can modify natural areas while vehicles driven off official routes may damage natural vegetation and cause erosion or soil compaction.
raw_text: Providing parking areas at the venue can modify natural areas while vehicles driven off official routes may damage natural vegetation and cause erosion or soil compaction.

sentences.text: Providing parking areas at the venue can modify natural areas while vehicles driven off official routes may damage natural vegetation and cause erosion or soil compaction.

clean_text: The following table sets out actions for transport service providers and on-site traffic management to mitigate impacts on biodiversity. The first column groups these actions within areas of potential impact on biodiversity, as described in Table 1, Part 1 of these guidelines. The second column indicates the phase of the event in which the action should be taken.

clean_text: Avoid using heavy vehicles in important areas for biodiversity  areas known to support populations of wild animals and plants, areas that can be easily destabilised like riverbanks, shorelines and sand dunes, and freshwater habitats and wetlands.
raw_text: Avoid using heavy vehicles in important areas for biodiversity  areas known to support populations of wild animals and plants, areas that can be easily destabilised like riverbanks, shorelines and sand dunes, and freshwater habitats and wetlands (Box 1).

sentences.text: Avoid using heavy vehicles in important areas for biodiversity  areas known to support populations of wild animals and plants, areas that can be easily destabilised like riverbanks, shorelines and sand dunes, and freshwater habitats and wetlands.

clean_text: Ensure that heavy vehicles do not park on ground under or close to mature trees where they can damage surface roots. All phases
raw_text: Ensure that heavy vehicles do not park on ground under or close to mature trees where they can damage surface roots. All phases

sentences.text: Ensure that heavy vehicles do not park on ground under or close to mature trees where they can damage surface roots.

clean_text: Make sure all vehicles use only marked roads, tracks and parking areas approved by the venue manager or events organising committee. All phases
raw_text: Make sure all vehicles use only marked roads, tracks and parking areas approved by the venue manager or events organising committee. All phases

sentences.text: Make sure all vehicles use only marked roads, tracks and parking areas approved by the venue manager or events organising committee.

clean_text: Limit traffic at dawn and dusk, at night and during times of peak activity of protected or threatened animal species where feasible. All phases
raw_text: Limit traffic at dawn and dusk, at night and during times of peak activity of protected or threatened animal species where feasible. All phases

sentences.text: Limit traffic at dawn and dusk, at night and during times of peak activity of protected or threatened animal species where feasible.

clean_text: Keep all vehicles transporting overlay, sports teams and athletes, and sporting equipment free of soil, plant material and seeds from outside the area, to prevent the introduction of alien invasive plants to the venue.
raw_text: Keep all vehicles transporting overlay, sports teams and athletes, and sporting equipment free of soil, plant material and seeds from outside the area, to prevent the introduction of alien invasive plants to the venue.

sentences.text: Keep all vehicles transporting overlay, sports teams and athletes, and sporting equipment free of soil, plant material and seeds from outside the area, to prevent the introduction of alien invasive plants to the venue.

clean_text: Immediately report any accidental fuel spills to the event organiser, venue manager and liquid waste management contractor to ensure pollution is contained and cleaned up quickly. All phases
raw_text: Immediately report any accidental fuel spills to the event organiser, venue manager and liquid waste management contractor to ensure pollution is contained and cleaned up quickly. All phases

sentences.text: Immediately report any accidental fuel spills to the event organiser, venue manager and liquid waste management contractor to ensure pollution is contained and cleaned up quickly.

clean_text: This section covers potential impacts caused by the presence, movement and behaviour of spectators at a sports event.
raw_text: This section covers potential impacts caused by the presence, movement and behaviour of spectators at a sports event.

sentences.text: This section covers potential impacts caused by the presence, movement and behaviour of spectators at a sports event.

clean_text: Biodiversity objectives  Avoid harm being caused by spectators, either intentionally or unintentionally, to wildlife and important areas for biodiversity.  Minimise impacts on natural ecosystems and wildlife due to the presence, movement and behaviour of spectators.
raw_text: Biodiversity objectives  Avoid harm being caused by spectators, either intentionally or unintentionally, to wildlife and important areas for biodiversity.  Minimise impacts on natural ecosystems and wildlife due to the presence, movement and behaviour of spectators.

sentences.text: Biodiversity objectives  Avoid harm being caused by spectators, either intentionally or unintentionally, to wildlife and important areas for biodiversity.
Minimise impacts on natural ecosystems and wildlife due to the presence, movement and behaviour of spectators.

clean_text: The presence of large numbers of spectators at sports events, although an opportunity to boost awareness of biodiversity, can lead to a range of negative impacts. For outdoor events, these could include direct damage to ecosystems and wildlife habitat, introduction of alien and invasive organisms or pathogens, noise and light pollution, waste generation and increased fire risk.
raw_text: The presence of large numbers of spectators at sports events, although an opportunity to boost awareness of biodiversity, can lead to a range of negative impacts. For outdoor events, these could include direct damage to ecosystems and wildlife habitat, introduction of alien and invasive organisms or pathogens, noise and light pollution, waste generation and increased fire risk.

sentences.text: The presence of large numbers of spectators at sports events, although an opportunity to boost awareness of biodiversity, can lead to a range of negative impacts.

For outdoor events, these could include direct damage to ecosystems and wildlife habitat, introduction of alien and invasive organisms or pathogens, noise and light pollution, waste generation and increased fire risk.

clean_text: Less obvious, indirect impacts include the increased use of water, energy and other natural resources for the event. There is clearly a need to manage spectators carefully at outdoor events, particularly in natural and modified landscapes but also in urban environments.
raw_text: Less obvious, indirect impacts include the increased use of water, energy and other natural resources for the event. There is clearly a need to manage spectators carefully at outdoor events, particularly in natural and modified landscapes but also in urban environments (Box 22).

sentences.text: Less obvious, indirect impacts include the increased use of water, energy and other natural resources for the event.
There is clearly a need to manage spectators carefully at outdoor events, particularly in natural and modified landscapes but also in urban environments.

clean_text: Measures taken to reduce impacts on important habitats during the 2012 Olympic Games included:  Metal crowd barrier fencing placed around key areas of extremely fragile habitat;  Stake and tape-type fencing used along habitat areas where crowd pressure was anticipated to be less intense;  Educational signage along metal barrier lines, on stakes in woodland areas; and  Briefing event stewards on habitat protection measures.
raw_text: Measures taken to reduce impacts on important habitats during the 2012 Olympic Games included:  Metal crowd barrier fencing placed around key areas of extremely fragile habitat;  Stake and tape-type fencing used along habitat areas where crowd pressure was anticipated to be less intense;  Educational signage along metal barrier lines, on stakes in woodland areas; and  Briefing event stewards on habitat protection measures.

sentences.text: Measures taken to reduce impacts on important habitats during the 2012 Olympic Games included:  Metal crowd barrier fencing placed around key areas of extremely fragile habitat;  Stake and tape-type fencing used along habitat areas where crowd pressure was anticipated to be less intense;  Educational signage along metal barrier lines, on stakes in woodland areas; and  Briefing event stewards on habitat protection measures

clean_text: The combination of barriers, signage and information led to a vast majority of spectators respecting the protection measures.
raw_text: The combination of barriers, signage and information led to a vast majority of spectators respecting the protection measures.

sentences.text: The combination of barriers, signage and information led to a vast majority of spectators respecting the protection measures.

clean_text: Brief stewards and volunteers before the event to ensure they are fully informed about the need for spectators to stay away from marked no go areas to avoid trampling of vegetation and loss of habitat. Setting up
raw_text: Brief stewards and volunteers before the event to ensure they are fully informed about the need for spectators to stay away from marked no go areas to avoid trampling of vegetation and loss of habitat. Setting up

sentences.text: Brief stewards and volunteers before the event to ensure they are fully informed about the need for spectators to stay away from marked no go areas to avoid trampling of vegetation and loss of habitat.

clean_text: Ensure that spectators do not access, trample or otherwise damage vegetation in, no go areas or important areas for biodiversity. Staging event
raw_text: Ensure that spectators do not access, trample or otherwise damage vegetation in, no go areas or important areas for biodiversity. Staging event

sentences.text: Ensure that spectators do not access, trample or otherwise damage vegetation in, no go areas or important areas for biodiversity.

clean_text: Brief stewards and volunteers before the event to ensure they are fully informed about dos and donts.
raw_text: Brief stewards and volunteers before the event to ensure they are fully informed about dos and donts (e.g. avoiding marked no go areas, no removal of wild animals or plants, no discarding of waste in the natural environment, and no feeding of wild animals).

sentences.text: Brief stewards and volunteers before the event to ensure they are fully informed about dos and donts.

clean_text: Use signs, information boards and clear route marking to guide spectators along approved routes and keep them away from important habitat, wildlife that is sensitive to noise and disturbance, and known breeding or nesting sites.
raw_text: Use signs, information boards and clear route marking to guide spectators along approved routes and keep them away from important habitat, wildlife that is sensitive to noise and disturbance, and known breeding or nesting sites.

sentences.text: Use signs, information boards and clear route marking to guide spectators along approved routes and keep them away from important habitat, wildlife that is sensitive to noise and disturbance, and known breeding or nesting sites.

clean_text: Use signage and information materials to help foster an interest in the venues natural environment and its biodiversity. Explain any restrictions on access or behaviour.

sentences.text: Use signage and information materials to help foster an interest in the venues natural environment and its biodiversity.

clean_text: Ensure there is no interference with or removal of temporary barriers, cables, wires or fencing erected to manage spectators and prevent movement into important areas for biodiversity. Staging event
raw_text: Ensure there is no interference with or removal of temporary barriers, cables, wires or fencing erected to manage spectators and prevent movement into important areas for biodiversity. Staging event

sentences.text: Ensure there is no interference with or removal of temporary barriers, cables, wires or fencing erected to manage spectators and prevent movement into important areas for biodiversity.

clean_text: The presence, numbers and behaviour of sports teams, comprising athletes and their support people  trainers, coaches, medics and so on  can affect biodiversity in several ways, particularly in outdoor events.
raw_text: The presence, numbers and behaviour of sports teams, comprising athletes and their support people  trainers, coaches, medics and so on  can affect biodiversity in several ways, particularly in outdoor events.

clean_text: Biodiversity objectives  Avoid harm to important areas for biodiversity.  Minimise impacts on natural ecosystems and wildlife due to the presence, movement and behaviour of sports teams.

clean_text: Sports teams and athletes can affect biodiversity both positively and negatively. They can raise awareness of biodiversity and champion conservation, or harm wildlife directly or indirectly. This could be by taking wild plants or animals from a site, increasing the risk of fire, unintentionally introducing alien, invasive plants or animals, or causing pollution. Any equipment and materials discarded in natural environments can cause injury or death to animals and should be re-used, recycled, or disposed of responsibly. Transporting sports teams and athletes can also generate a range of negative impacts as covered in previous sections.
raw_text: Sports teams and athletes can affect biodiversity both positively and negatively. They can raise awareness of biodiversity and champion conservation, or harm wildlife directly or indirectly. This could be by taking wild plants or animals from a site, increasing the risk of fire (e.g. by discarding a lit cigarette), unintentionally introducing alien, invasive plants or animals (e.g. insect eggs on equipment), or causing pollution. Any equipment and materials discarded in natural environments can cause injury or death to animals and should be re-used, recycled, or disposed of responsibly. Transporting sports teams and athletes can also generate a range of negative impacts as covered in previous sections.

sentences.text: Sports teams and athletes can affect biodiversity both positively and negatively.
They can raise awareness of biodiversity and champion conservation, or harm wildlife directly or indirectly.
This could be by taking wild plants or animals from a site, increasing the risk of fire, unintentionally introducing alien, invasive plants or animals, or causing pollution.
Any equipment and materials discarded in natural environments can cause injury or death to animals and should be re-used, recycled, or disposed of responsibly.
Transporting sports teams and athletes can also generate a range of negative impacts as covered in previous sections.
